title: Sherlock_BBC_Radio
description:
These recordings are of the BBC Audio Complete Sherlock Holmes. They 
represent the first and only time all 56 canonical Holmes stories were 
produced with the same actors in the principal roles of Holmes and 
Watson: Clive Merrison and Michael Williams.

The Further Adventures of Sherlock Holmes were written by Bert Coules 
and inspired by throwaway lines in the canonical stories by Sir Arthur 
Conan Doyle.  Clive Merrison appeared again as Holmes, but Michael 
Williams died shortly before production was to begin.  Andrew Sachs was 
then cast as Watson.

The stories were broadcast in the following order:

A Study in Scarlet
Recorded October 1989
First broadcast 5th and 12th November 1989

The Sign of the Four
Recorded October 1989
First broadcast 10th and 17th December 1989

The Adventures of Sherlock Holmes
Series recorded between July and October 1990 
First broadcast between November 1990 and February 1991

The Memoirs of Sherlock Holmes
Series recorded July 1991
First broadcast between January 1992 and November 1992

The Return of Sherlock Holmes
Series recorded between June and October 1992
First broadcast between February 1993 and October 1993

His Last Bow
Series recorded July 1993 
First broadcast between January and February 1994

The Valley of Fear
Recorded February 1997 
First broadcast 23rd and 30th March 1997 

The Casebook of Sherlock Holmes
Series recorded April - October 1994 
First broadcast between September 1994 and March 1995.

The Hound of the Baskervilles
Recorded May 1998 
First broadcast 28th June and 5th July 1998 

==========

The Further Adventures of Sherlock Holmes

Series One recorded October 2001
First broadcast between January and February 2002

Series Two recorded between December 2003 and February 2004
First broadcast between May 2004 and June 2004

Series Three recorded October 2008
First broadcast between December 2008 and January 2009

Series Four recorded December 2009
First broadcast 5th and 6th April 2010
